summary: This document is an email chain from June 2008 scheduling a phone call to discuss 'Epstein' for the morning of Friday, June 13, 2008. It shows coordination among multiple participants to arrange a 30-minute call, indicating ongoing discussions or planning related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The entire email chain is about scheduling a call to discuss 'Epstein', indicating he is the central topic of the planned conversation.

events.title: Scheduled phone call to discuss Epstein
events.description: A 30-minute phone call was scheduled for 10:00 AM Eastern Time to discuss Jeffrey Epstein. The call was to be conducted from an office ('ofc.') with remote participation available.

keyFacts: A phone call was scheduled for June 13, 2008, specifically to discuss Jeffrey Epstein.
The email chain shows active coordination among multiple participants to arrange this discussion.
The document originates from 2008, a period when Epstein was under investigation and prior to his 2008 plea deal.
The subject line and content consistently refer to 'Epstein', confirming he was the focal point of the planned communication.
